location.scene: is where Martins learns his pal died after being hit by a truck
is where Martins learns his pal died after being hit by a truck
is where Martins learns his pal died after being hit by a truck
Opera House scene
wedding in St. Michael's Church, Vienna
Both meet for the first time in the train and decide to spend the day together in Vienna.
They start strolling through town with mixed feelings in the beginning.
Jesse and Celine explore the Ring and ask themselves intimate questions.
In a record shop Celine chooses Kath Bloom to listen to with Jesse.
Celine tells Jesse about the story behind this Cemetery.
They kiss on the Ferris Wheel and stroll through the amusement park.
In the evening they drink something at the "Kleines Café". A plamist reads Celine's future.
Both take a look at this church. Inside they start talking about pain and happiness in life.
A poet sitting by the Donaukanal spontaneously writes a poem for Celine and Jesse.
By chance they pass the club Arena, go inside, play pinball and talk about past and current relationships.
Celine and Jesse, discussing Feminism, walk down the Mölkersteig.
Walking through Spittelberg, they watch a belly dancer dancing the dance of birth.
They play a fictitious roleplay together, where they call they close friends at home and talk about their experience so far.
Jesse tries to get a bottle of wine, while Celine steels two glasses.
They sit by the Franz Josef I. Statue on the balcony and Jesse mentions a poem by W.H. Auden "As I walked out one evening".
Both lay on the grass talking about how much intimacy is appropiate.
